alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTHEASTERN MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MDT... At 258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Valmora, or 21 miles east of Las Vegas, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central San Miguel and southeastern Mora Counties. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 17 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
